paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 c.68‐7T > A variant, its non-pathogenicity, and provides insights into its functional effects and penetrance data.

patients.demographics: female, recruited from the Istituto Nazionale dei Tumori (INT) of Milan
patients.phenotype: not specified, but carriers were healthy female blood donors

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In this analysis 18 LCLs were considered, including six LCLs obtained from women carrying the BRCA2 c.68‐7T > A variant and 12 LCLs obtained from healthy female blood donors.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to an increase of the naturally occurring transcripts lacking exon 3 (Δ3) and a decrease of transcripts retaining exon 3 (▼3).

variants.segregation_data: The variant did not segregate in the affected branches of families.
variants.population_frequency: Allelic frequency ranging from 0.02% in East Asians to 0.5% in non-Finnish Europeans.
variants.additional_notes: The study provides robust evidence against the pathogenicity of the BRCA2 c.68‐7T > A variant.
key_quotes: Our data provide for the first time robust evidence of the nonpathogenicity of the BRCA2 c.68‐7T > A.
The posterior probability of pathogenicity was 7.44 × 10−115.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
